team.name: Spain
team.introduction: The Spain SailGP Team holds the record as the youngest team to compete in SailGP yet, after making its racing debut in Season 2. The Team embodies rebellion and passion. As champions of SailGP Season 4, we continue to push the limits of speed. Los Gallos is led by the partnership of driver Diego Botin and wing trimmer Florian Trittel. The team includes top tier sailing talent, including flight controller Joel Rodriguez, tactician & grinder Joan Cardona, strategist Nicole van der Velden and grinder Bernardo Freitas.

team.name: Australia
team.introduction: Led by legendary sailor Tom Slingsby, the Australia SailGP Team was three-time back-to-back SailGP Champions from Seasons 1-3, earning a formidable reputation among the F50 fleet. As one of the six original teams which began the Championship in 2019, the Flying Roos are populated with experienced sailors, including driver Slingsby, wing trimmer Chris Draper and flight controller Jason Waterhouse, alongside strategists Nina Curtis and Natasha Bryant.

partners.message: Parley for the Oceans is a global environmental organization and network where creators, thinkers and leaders come together to raise awareness for the beauty and fragility of the oceans and collaborate on projects that can end their destruction.

team.name: New Zealand
team.fullName: Black Foils, New Zealand SailGP Team
team.introduction: Led by legendary sailing duo Peter Burling and Blair Tuke, New Zealand entered SailGP in Season 2. Since then, the team has grown into one of the most formidable in the league, often jostling with Australia at the top of the Championship leaderboard. Racing under its bold new identity, Black Foils, the Kiwis proudly represent Aotearoa New Zealand, while competing on the international sporting stage. Alongside its on-water performance, the Black Foils are driven by the mission to race for a healthy ocean and uses the platform of SailGP to communicate the importance of ocean restoration with its partner Live Ocean Foundation, the marine conservation charity founded by Burling and Tuke.

team.name: ROCKWOOL DEN
team.introduction: ROCKWOOL Denmark SailGP Team is led by multi-time round-the-world ocean racer Nicolai Sehested and features a wealth of homegrown Danish talent, including the likes of flight controller Rasmus Køstner, grinder Hans-Christian Rosendahl and Danish Olympic heroes Anne-Marie Rindom and Katja Salskov-Iversen. Known for its methodical approach to racing, the Danish team has become a fierce on-water competitor, racking up a slew of podium-topping performances. Alongside racing, the team has sustainability at its heart - and won the Season 3 Impact League with the support of partners ROCKWOOL and One Ocean Foundation.

team.name: ROCKWOOL DEN
team.introduction: ROCKWOOL Denmark SailGP Team is led by multi-time round-the-world ocean racer Nicolai Sehested and features a wealth of homegrown Danish talent, including the likes of flight controller Rasmus Køstner, grinder Hans-Christian Rosendahl and Danish Olympic heroes Anne-Marie Rindom and Katja Salskov-Iversen. Known for its methodical approach to racing, the Danish team has become a fierce on-water competitor, racking up a slew of podium-topping performances. Alongside racing, the team has sustainability at its heart - and won the Season 3 Impact League with the support of partners ROCKWOOL and One Ocean Foundation.

team.name: France
team.introduction: One of the six original SailGP Teams, France is spearheaded by driver Quentin Delapierre who assembled a stellar crew line-up when he took over as driver in Season 2. His ranks include wing trimmer Kevin Peponnet and flight controller Jason Saunders, who race with Les Bleus alongside strategists Amelie Riou and Manon Audinet, and grinders Matthieu Vandame, Olivier Herledant and Timothe Lapauw. The France SailGP Team, known as Les Bleus, favors wild and windy conditions, and holds the SailGP speed record of 99.94 km/h.

team.name: Emirates GBR
team.introduction: Carrying the flag for the UK, the Emirates Great Britain SailGP Team is driven by double Olympic Gold medallist Giles Scott. Alongside Scott, Emirates GBR’s crew line-up is packed with the country’s top sporting talent, including the most successful female Olympic sailor, strategist Hannah Mills OBE. Scott and Mills are joined by flight controller Luke Parkinson, wing trimmer Iain Jensen, strategist Hannah Diamond and grinders Neil Hunter, Nick Hutton and Matt Gotrel MBE. Emirates GBR was the first team to take franchise ownership, with former Driver and the most successful male Olympic sailor of all-time, Sir Ben Ainslie, taking on the role as CEO. Emirates GBR has been a formidable force on the SailGP race track since it joined the league. Emirates GBR is also committed to the Impact League with its Race For The Future partner, Protect Our Future, and its ambition to empower 3 million young people to take climate action by the end of Season 5.

team.name: Switzerland
team.introduction: Switzerland heads into its third Season with a refreshed line-up and new mindset, bringing together a crew of seasoned Olympians, America’s Cup experience and past SailGP winners. Sebastien Schneiter retains his role as driver and racing alongside are some of SUI’s top sailors; new wing trimmer and flight controller, Arnaud Psarofaghis and Bryan Mettraux, and two-time Olympian, Maud Jayet (strategist). Olympic gold medalist, Matt Gotrel and Season 4 winner, Stewart Dodson complete the line-up as grinders with reserve athletes, Arno de Planta (SUI pathway) and Laurane Mettraux (strategist) supporting.

team.name: Canada
team.introduction: Blazing into their third season in the league is the Canada SailGP Team with Giles Scott as driver. The team is packed with homegrown Canadian talent, including flight controller Billy Gooderham, strategists Annie Haeger and Georgia Lewin-LaFrance, as well as grinders Tim Hornsby, Jareese Finch and Tom Ramshaw.

team.name: Germany
team.introduction: The Germany SailGP Team entered the league with a bang at the beginning of Season 4 and has impressed since its debut, with Olympian Erik Heil behind the wheel. Alongside Heil, the German team includes a talented sailing line-up, including experienced wing trimmer Stuart Bithell and flight controller James Wierzbowski. Alongside a stellar cast of athletes, the German team boasts a star-studded ownership team, including Thomas Riedel, president of the eponymous leading communications company Riedel Communications, and four-time F1 World Champion Sebastian Vettel.

team.name: Switzerland
team.introduction: Switzerland heads into its third Season with a refreshed line-up and new mindset, bringing together a crew of seasoned Olympians, America’s Cup experience and past SailGP winners. Sebastien Schneiter retains his role as driver and racing alongside are some of SUI’s top sailors; new wing trimmer and flight controller, Arnaud Psarofaghis and Bryan Mettraux, and two-time Olympian, Maud Jayet (strategist). Olympic gold medalist, Matt Gotrel and Season 4 winner, Stewart Dodson complete the line-up as grinders with reserve athletes, Arno de Planta (SUI pathway) and Laurane Mettraux (strategist) supporting.
